wikipedia_page.main:
Dame Caroline Jan MacEwen  is a Consultant ophthalmologist at Ninewells Hospital in Dundee and the Chair of the Academy of Medical Royal Colleges (2017–2020) and the former President of the Royal College of Ophthalmologists in the UK, (2014-2017). She is honorary Professor and head of the Ophthalmology Department at Dundee University's School of Medicine  and Associate Dean for less than full time training in the East of Scotland. She is the Ophthalmology Specialty Adviser to the CMO in Scotland and co-clinical lead for the Getting it Right First Time (GIRFT) ophthalmology programme for NHS England. In 2018, Dr Linda Charles-Ozuzu, a Director for NHS England and NHS Improvement, and Professor MacEwen co-founded EyesWise, a project to end avoidable  sight loss in England in line with Vision 2020
MacEwen was Included in the HSJ “most influential people in the NHS” top 100 (2018) and in ‘The Ophthalmologist’ power list of top 100 ophthalmologists globally (2019).

response: The Chief Executive Officer is Jane Ingham. |url=https://www.hqip.org.uk/about-us/our-team/#.YBcXD-j7SM8 |access date=31 January 2021 The Trustee Board of HQIP includes the following members: Professor Carrie MacEwen - chair, Alistair Henderson - vice chair, Phil Baker, Sheila Marriott, Victoria Tzortziou Brown, Sarah Dunnett, Michael Chapman, Susan Masters, Miles Sibley.  |url=https://www.hqip.org.uk/about-us/board-accounts-annual-reports/#.YBcTAej7SM8 |access date=31 January 2021
In July 2020 she became chair of the Academy of Medical Royal Colleges for three year term, succeeding Carrie MacEwen.
